New Records: Shaheen Shah Afridi returned career-best figures of 4-22
Key Match Events: Litton Das was sent back by Shaheen Shah Afridi for 10
Najmul Hossain Shanto capitalised on a reprieve and top-scored with 54 for Bangladesh
Shadab Khan dropped Najmul Hossain Shanto on 11 at short extra
Shadab struck twice on successive balls, dismissing Shakib Al Hasan lbw
Mohammad Rizwan fell to fast bowler Ebadot Hossain in the next over
Mohammad Haris made 31 and put on partnerships to guide Pakistan into the semi-finals
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan bounced back from the opening match defeat against India and a shock loss to Zimbabwe to outplay South Africa last week
Post-Match Reflections: Man of the match Afridi said: “I have improved. [It was] not easy to come back from injury … but I’m trying my best. As a team, we are very happy. We’ve played great. Bowl in the right areas and fast was the plan.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan achieved their target with 11 balls to spare and join India in the final four from Group 2
Muhammad Rizwan top-scored for Pakistan against Bangladesh with a run-a-ball 32
The match turned into a virtual quarter-final after the Netherlands stunned South Africa in the opening match of the day
Others: Pakistan recover from losses in the opening two matches to reach the last four
Pakistan join India in the final four from Group 2
